sanskrit_verse:
शरीरकर्षणात्प्राणाः क्षीयन्ते प्राणिनां यथा ।
तथा राज्ञामपि प्राणाः क्षीयन्ते राष्ट्रकर्षणात् ॥ ७.११२॥
transliteration: śarīrakarṣaṇāt prāṇāḥ kṣīyante prāṇināṃ yathā | tathā rājñām api prāṇāḥ kṣīyante rāṣṭrakarṣaṇāt || 7.112||
sph_interpretive_translation: As the life forces of beings wane through bodily strain, so too do the vital energies of rulers diminish when they draw excessively from the nation.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is inseparable from energetic sustainability.
Causation flows from misalignment between governance and national integrity.
Capacity-based responsibility requires rulers to maintain equilibrium with the state's vitality.
Restoration logic demands replenishment of depleted sovereign energy.
Consciousness alignment necessitates rulers embodying the welfare of the nation as their own being.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a ruler’s actions demonstrably deplete national resources beyond sustainable thresholds, THEN initiate restorative capacity-realignment protocols.
IF governance causes systemic exhaustion in the body politic, THEN enforce completion processes for energetic recalibration.
IF a ruler fails to sustain the life-force of the nation, THEN assign responsibility assumption mechanisms until balance is restored.
IF national vitality declines due to excessive extraction by authority, THEN activate integrity reintegration procedures for leadership consciousness.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating executive overreach or policy-induced societal depletion, the Supreme Court must assess not only legal compliance but also the energetic impact on the nation’s well-being. The threshold of responsibility lies in the measurable diminishment of collective vitality attributable to governance patterns.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that exhaustion arises sequentially from misaligned action. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how draining the nation leads to diminished sovereignty. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of disruption caused. Non-punitive reality affirms that correction restores dharma without inflicting harm upon the ruler.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate sovereign energy replenishment through guided retreat and dharmic recalibration.
Assign completion processes wherein rulers engage directly with affected communities to restore trust and coherence.
Implement responsibility assumption protocols requiring personal accountability for energetic imbalances caused.
Facilitate capacity restoration via mentorship under realized spiritual and administrative guides aligned with SPH’s teachings.
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma stands restored through recognition of sovereign interdependence. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
